headline: A Look Back at the US EV Market in 2024: What to Expect in 2025
summary: U.S. EV sales surge to 1.3 million units in 2024, but with tax credits at risk, will 2025 sustain the momentum?

headline: Stricter rules strip some EVs, PHEVs of $7,500 federal tax-credit eligibility in 2025
summary: More EV models have been approved for Inflation Reduction Act tax credits in 2025 than in 2024 — 27, up from 22, according to the U.S. Department of Energy — though not all are yet on sale.

raw.headline: Stricter rules strip some EVs, PHEVs of $7,500 federal tax-credit eligibility in 2025

headline: 1 Reason Why GM Stock Is Soaring Above Rival Ford
summary: Of all the great rivalries throughout time, whether it be sports or business, or something else, you'd be hard pressed to find as great a rivalry as Ford Motor Company (NYSE: F) and General Motors (NYSE: GM).  For instance, Ford's total U.S. sales increased 4% during 2024, compared to the prior year, to nearly 2.1 million vehicles.  General Motors also posted a 4% sales gain in the U.S. for 2.7 million vehicles -- both posting their highest total since 2019.

headline: Is Ford a Millionaire Maker Stock?
summary: Ford Motor Company (NYSE: F) is an iconic name in the auto sector with a long history of success.  Ford is one of the largest automotive companies on the planet, with a market cap of around $40 billion.  In 2024, the company sold more than 2 million vehicles, with especially rapid growth in the sales of electric (EV) and hybrid vehicles.

headline: Free Trade Boosted These Cities During Trump 1.0. His Policies Now Threaten to Undo Them.
summary: The experiences of Detroit and Laredo, Texas, show how interconnected trade is between the U.S., Canada and Mexico. Tariffs could represent a blow to both cities.
